answer:
The National Advisory Committee on Immunization does not have a recommendation at this time for Human Papillomavirus (HPV) Vaccine for heterosexual males who are older than 26 years of age. Please discuss the HPV vaccine with your primary health care provider. The HPV9 vaccine is available for purchase from most pharmacies in BC, travel health clinics and some medical clinics. The cost may vary, (approximately $180-200 per dose) and there may be an additional vaccine administration fee.
Immunization Nurse
question: Where can I go and what does it cost to get the three vaccinations against HPV if I am a heterosexual male BC resident under 29 years of age?
